* Model: M105-S3041
* Website: http://seiti.eti.br/wiki/UbuntuLaptop (in Portuguese)

=== Current Issues ===
The notebook has a US style keyboard. But even setting it to US International (with dead keys) the cedilla does not work correctly (it prints ''ฤ'' instead of ''รง''). To workaround this problem, edit the <code>/etc/gtk2.0/gtk.immodules</code> file, adding <code>en</code> to the end of this line:

<code>"cedilla" "Cedilla" "gtk+" "/usr/share/locale" "az:ca:co:fr:gv:oc:pt:sq:tr:wa"</code>

to make it look like this:

<code>"cedilla" "Cedilla" "gtk+" "/usr/share/locale" "az:ca:co:fr:gv:oc:pt:sq:tr:wa:en"</code>

OR just get used with using ''R_CTRL'' + '','' then ''c'' to get the ''รง''.

==== Notes ====
When switching display modes ('''Fn + F5''') the notebook screen gets "scrumbled", but changing to terminal (CTRL + ALT + F1) and then back to X (CTRL + ALT + F7) the screen gets normal again.

Had to remove .asoundrc to make system sounds work (login, logout, click, error sounds...):

<pre>
rm .asoundrc*
</pre>
